  • Constructor Details

    • EventTableTest

      public EventTableTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      public void setUp()

    • fetchEvent_success

      @Order(1) public void fetchEvent_success()
      Tests the successful retrieval of an event from the database. A mock DocumentReference is created to simulate the return of an existing profile. Success is confirmed with the callback's onSuccess method where the returned profile's data is validated.

    • fetchEvent_noEventFound

      @Order(2) public void fetchEvent_noEventFound()
      Tests the scenario where an event is not found in the database. A mock DocumentReference is created and its get method return is simulated with a document that doesn't exist. The failure is confirmed if the onFailure method is invoked in the callback.

    • fetchEvent_failure

      @Order(3) public void fetchEvent_failure()
      Tests the failure scenario when fetching an event from the database. The get method of the document reference is mocked to throw an exception. Failure is confirmed in the callback's onFailure method with a non-null exception.

    • addEvent_success

      @Order(4) public void addEvent_success()
      Tests the successful addition of an event to the database. The addition is mocked to return a successful Task. Success is confirmed if a non-null profile is received in the callback's onSuccess method.

    • deleteProfile_success

      @Order(5) public void deleteProfile_success()
      Tests the successful deletion of a profile in the database. A mock is created for DocumentReference, and its delete method is mocked to return a successful Task. The test successfully deletes the profile if the callback's onSuccess method is invoked.

    • testUpdateEvent_success

      @Order(6) public void testUpdateEvent_success()
      Tests the successful update of an event in the database. A mock profile and DocumentReference are created. The document's set method is mocked to return a successful Task. The test then attempts to update the document and confirms success by checking that the result is non-null.

    • profileLifecycle_integration

      public void profileLifecycle_integration() throws InterruptedException
      This test is an integration test to verify an event's lifecycle in the LIVE(!) database. It executes the following steps:

      Step 1: Create a new event and add it to the database. The generated ID of the newly added event is captured.

      Step 2: Update the event's name and save the update to the database.

      Step 3: Fetch the updated event from the database and verify if the name was successfully updated.

      Step 4: Delete the event from the database.

      Step 5: Attempt to fetch the deleted event from the database. This should return null since the event has been deleted.

      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if any of the database operations are interrupted
